blog.name: pepper-stark
blog.title: The Stars Are A Part Of Us
blog.description:
Kayla/Millennial/Bi/Ohio

Married to my wife since 8/7/15

Multifandom Blog. Obsessed with many things on a slightly unhealthy level. Living my best life in 20BITEEN. Being the baddest bitch I can be.

Send me asks or message me! I love making new friends and I’m always down to chat and answer your asks!

Header made by @tonyspepper

summary: I realize that The Winter Soldier was responsible for Howard and Maria Stark’s death, but Bucky Barnes was not. So in that...
body: I realize that The Winter Soldier was responsible for Howard and Maria Stark’s death, but Bucky Barnes was not. So in that moment where we had to say goodbye to Tony, seeing that Bucky was there filled my heart with joy for one fleeting second. He was there to pay his respects to the man who saved humanity. THAT is who Bucky Barnes is. THAT is the kind of man he is, and I love him because of it.

reblog.comment: I realize that The Winter Soldier was responsible for Howard and Maria Stark’s death, but Bucky Barnes was not. So in that moment where we had to say goodbye to Tony, seeing that Bucky was there filled my heart with joy for one fleeting second. He was there to pay his respects to the man who saved humanity. THAT is who Bucky Barnes is. THAT is the kind of man he is, and I love him because of it.

So in that moment where we had to say goodbye to Tony, seeing that Bucky was there filled my heart with joy for one fleeting second. He was there to pay his respects to the man who saved humanity. THAT is who Bucky Barnes is. THAT is the kind of man he is, and I love him because of it.

So in that moment where we had to say goodbye to Tony, seeing that Bucky was there filled my heart with joy for one fleeting second. He was there to pay his respects to the man who saved humanity. THAT is who Bucky Barnes is. THAT is the kind of man he is, and I love him because of it.

blog.name: shestillhashersoul
blog.title: We are all stories in the end. Make it a good one.
blog.description: Judith, 36, Spanish, Pepperony, Tony Stark, Pepper Potts, Morgan Stark, Iron Man Trilogy, Movies, Sailor Moon, Disney.

summary: Pepper & Tony in “Avengers: Endgame”
body:
Pepper & Tony in “Avengers: Endgame”

Worst ending ever. Nothing prepared me for this. God, I can’t believe this is the real deal. That’s it. Tony’s dead, Pepper’s a widow, Morgan’s a fatherless orphan child at age 5. How cool right? 

Speaking as a Tony and Pepper fan they give us everything we wished for during all those 11 years, right? Pepperony married and iron baby girl and Rescue… BUT, there always has to be a but, only to kill Tony, love of my life, Stark in the end and stab our hearts with a knife, and tarnish all our memories of the MCU and this 11 years. 

We didn’t get our wedding. They were married off-screen. Yeah another big #Pepperony event that happens off-screen YAY! Just like the break in “Civil War” which we will never know a single thing about. We can add to this the wedding that happened but we never saw, we’ll have to use the power of imagination. I loved to see the ring on Tony’s hand though. I delighted in it. ^^

My queen Pepper Potts wasn’t nearly enough on screen. No Mom-Pepper time with Morgan (only the funeral/post-funeral hologram thingy) so so sad. 

Remember when we all thought that scene by the lake was the wedding? Sure, good times.

Speaking of this… Could this funeral be more fast paced? Hey Tony, here you go bye bye. Let’s have 15 minutes more about Captain America’s whereabouts. Russos, Markus, MCFeely we know you love Cap BUT show some respect, because Tony Stark just died sacrificing himself to save the fucking Marvel Multiverse or whatever this quantum time travel shit ended doing with the time-space dimension. Future movies are gonna be a crazy convoluted mess, let me tell you. I don’t care. Won’t be seeing any of them. Good luck explaining THAT. lol :D

Back to Pepper Potts. She suited up at last, after 22 movies, as RESCUE, and she was a glorious kick ass queen in her purple and gold suit of armour… YAY! but it wasn’t even close to enough. I think even Valkirye got twice her screentime in that battle, logicall if they want to sell us “the future of the MCU” without shame. Rescue in the final battle was so brief I couldn’t even taste it. No explanation about how or why she finally put herself on the suit, only that she finally wore something her beloved husband did for her (that was super cute, let me tell you). But it sure gives the impression that she was only thrown in there because in the moment Tony died she could hold him in her arms. Beautifully acted scene that makes me cry again only thinking about it. Gwyneth Paltrow can give acting skills class to half of the cast in this movies. That’s an Oscar winning actress for you all, take notes. 

“We’ll be okay. You can rest now.” That broke my heart.

Where the hell is my TEAM IRON MAN battle scene? War Machine, Iron Man and Rescue fighting together like an armored team? Never to be seen. We lose that opportunity, sad forever. :(

More scenes of Pepper with Tony in their cottage by the lake would have hurt someone? Their everyday life with Morgan? I guess we’ll have to go to fanfic to cover those needs too. ¬¬

“I love you 3000″ made my heart sing. So lovely and cute and Tony telling Pepper how much their daughter loves him. That was the sweetest thing I’ve seen in my life.

I loved when Tony disguised himself as Howard Potts in front of his father, really made me smile. Tony is so in love with Pepper and respects her so much :) Cutie pie.

There were truly amazing and cute and lovely scenes that I will treasure forever BUT at the same time I’m salty, and pissed, and kinda disappointed, mostly because after 11 years of loyalty, buying ticketts, blu ray, merchan and free promotion of the Marvel brand, we only wanted Tony Stark to retire in the end and truly SEE his wedding with Pepper on screen. It’s all we wanted. Retirement for him and to have a good memory of these 11 years forever. Not this sacrificial death thing. 

I guess doing the surprise move was more important than viewers satisfaction. 

That “we all want a happy ending but sometimes we can’t have one” sorry Tony/Robert but my soul will always feed on happy endings. And fantasy should guarantee them. Life is hard enough.

***HUGE SPOILERS FOR AVENGERS: ENDGAME***
I watch endgame yesterday, i can’t stop crying. Here i am going to say everything that should have been said in the movie.
The reader is an avenger, and loved natasha, but their relationship was complicated.

blog.name: itismarvelicious

blog.description: French. 25. | Fixing Avengers: Endgame here. | I take prompts. | Pepperony mainly.

summary: Endgame spoilers
body:
Endgame spoilers

So I guess… I need a Pepperony movie about those last five years to cope. Show me Pepper’s pregnancy, Tony’s reaction to finding out Pepper’s pregnant, Morgan’s birth, Pepper and Tony’s wedding, Tony and Pepper being awesome parents. Show me the little bits of happiness they had during those last five years, we only saw so little of it and will never see that again. I just need to see Tony happy. I need to see more of this life he always dreamed of. I need to see him living his dream, even if it was in the darkest of times.

summary: ok but is Peter ever going to know that Tony did it all for him? of course the rest of the world was a factor because Tony can’t...
body:
ok but is Peter ever going to know that Tony did it all for him? of course the rest of the world was a factor because Tony can’t resist helping everyone, but Peter was the catalyst. It was Tony’s love for Peter that drove him to invent time travel and help with the Avengers’ crazy plan, which eventually led to him giving his life for the world

it was Tony’s love for Peter that put everything in motion, and I just desperately need him to know that

blog.description: Exactly what it sounds like. I like fandoms and I have random thoughts that need to be expressed sometimes. Also PLEASE suggest fics I should write!

tags: this girl is gonna have so much adopted family
summary: He’s Not Really Gone
body:
He’s Not Really Gone

((ENDGAME SPOILERS PROCEED WITH CAUTION!!!))

Maybe Morgan didn’t really know why her daddy couldn’t come back, but she did know that he wasn’t really gone.

He was everywhere.

He was there every time Uncle Rhodey sat by her bed until she fell asleep, and every time DUM-E tried his best to ruffle her hair without bumping her on the head too hard.

He was in Uncle Clint sneaking her a cookie and telling her stories about Aunt Nat, and in Uncle Thor taking her up on the roof to show her the constellations.

He was in Aunt Nebula showing her the right way to make a fist, and in Happy teaching her how to make the best cheeseburgers in the world.

He was there when Aunt Maria smiled as she told her a a story that Iron Man would have been embarrassed about, and he was there when F.R.I.D.A.Y called her “Little Boss.”

He was in Shuri helping her with her homework, and Groot forming flower after flower because it made her laugh.

He was there as Uncle Bruce swung her around over his head, and as Uncle Nick and Uncle Steve told her all about God-Grandma Peggy, and about Grandpa Howard.

Daddy was there every time Mommy sang her to sleep or brushed her hair.

He was there each night she fell asleep on the couch between Peter and Harley during a movie, knowing they weren’t her real brothers, but that didn’t matter because it felt like they were.

Morgan might not really understand why her daddy couldn’t come back. But she did understand that the older she got, the more she saw her daddy in her smile.

summary: I feel like no one is talking about Tony and Steve's confrontation scene, but it's so important!!! can we please just take a...
body: I feel like no one is talking about Tony and Steve’s confrontation scene, but it’s so important!!! can we please just take a moment and appreciate this, because it was such a much needed scene. “I needed you. You weren’t there.” holds so much depth and hurt. Tony felt betrayed and alone, he felt like he lost a friend he could count on. Steve broke his trust and Tony wasn’t just hurt, he was genuinely mad at him. And finally after so long, he let out everything he wanted to say. He embraced his pain and confronted his trauma. And i’m glad we could see him being so emotional, because this has been something that’s been hurting him for such a long time. As for Steve, he finally realized how deeply he hurt Tony. He could see how much impact it had on him and he could feel it up close at last. Tony needed to snap at him and Steve needed to hear this out, so they could both finally move on. It was such a heartbreaking, intense, yet beautiful and cathartic scene.

reblog.comment: I feel like no one is talking about Tony and Steve’s confrontation scene, but it’s so important!!! can we please just take a moment and appreciate this, because it was such a much needed scene. “I needed you. You weren’t there.” holds so much depth and hurt. Tony felt betrayed and alone, he felt like he lost a friend he could count on. Steve broke his trust and Tony wasn’t just hurt, he was genuinely mad at him. And finally after so long, he let out everything he wanted to say. He embraced his pain and confronted his trauma. And i’m glad we could see him being so emotional, because this has been something that’s been hurting him for such a long time. As for Steve, he finally realized how deeply he hurt Tony. He could see how much impact it had on him and he could feel it up close at last. Tony needed to snap at him and Steve needed to hear this out, so they could both finally move on. It was such a heartbreaking, intense, yet beautiful and cathartic scene.

trail.content_raw: I feel like no one is talking about Tony and Steve’s confrontation scene, but it’s so important!!! can we please just take a moment and appreciate this, because it was such a much needed scene. “I needed you. You weren’t there.” holds so much depth and hurt. Tony felt betrayed and alone, he felt like he lost a friend he could count on. Steve broke his trust and Tony wasn’t just hurt, he was genuinely mad at him. And finally after so long, he let out everything he wanted to say. He embraced his pain and confronted his trauma. And i’m glad we could see him being so emotional, because this has been something that’s been hurting him for such a long time. As for Steve, he finally realized how deeply he hurt Tony. He could see how much impact it had on him and he could feel it up close at last. Tony needed to snap at him and Steve needed to hear this out, so they could both finally move on. It was such a heartbreaking, intense, yet beautiful and cathartic scene.
trail.content: I feel like no one is talking about Tony and Steve’s confrontation scene, but it’s so important!!! can we please just take a moment and appreciate this, because it was such a much needed scene. “I needed you. You weren’t there.” holds so much depth and hurt. Tony felt betrayed and alone, he felt like he lost a friend he could count on. Steve broke his trust and Tony wasn’t just hurt, he was genuinely mad at him. And finally after so long, he let out everything he wanted to say. He embraced his pain and confronted his trauma. And i’m glad we could see him being so emotional, because this has been something that’s been hurting him for such a long time. As for Steve, he finally realized how deeply he hurt Tony. He could see how much impact it had on him and he could feel it up close at last. Tony needed to snap at him and Steve needed to hear this out, so they could both finally move on. It was such a heartbreaking, intense, yet beautiful and cathartic scene.

summary: Look, I’m not a big Marvel fan (although still don’t spoil Endgame for me, I’m not seeing it until Wednesday), but I will always...
body: Look, I’m not a big Marvel fan (although still don’t spoil Endgame for me, I’m not seeing it until Wednesday), but I will always appreciate Tony Stark for actually having PTSD. It’s probably the only representation for it I’ve ever seen.

reblog.comment: Look, I’m not a big Marvel fan (although still don’t spoil Endgame for me, I’m not seeing it until Wednesday), but I will always appreciate Tony Stark for actually having PTSD. It’s probably the only representation for it I’ve ever seen.

trail.content_raw: Look, I’m not a big Marvel fan (although still don’t spoil Endgame for me, I’m not seeing it until Wednesday), but I will always appreciate Tony Stark for actually having PTSD. It’s probably the only representation for it I’ve ever seen.
trail.content: Look, I’m not a big Marvel fan (although still don’t spoil Endgame for me, I’m not seeing it until Wednesday), but I will always appreciate Tony Stark for actually having PTSD. It’s probably the only representation for it I’ve ever seen.
